author: {'steamid': '76561198407570388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1688265321}
review: The volume of the sound would not adjust for me, so it was very loud. Also, I was disappointed to find that the game is virtually unplayable if you have issues seeing low contrast images, because there is no way to adjust the visuals.  Yes, I understand that the game is meant to be about shadows and the interplay between darkness and light, but I have played plenty of games of this sort that I am still able to see because I can tweak the video settings just enough. Besides, this is not a horror game that relies on darkness for spookiness, this is a puzzle game that has no combat and no jumpscares (admittedly I didn't play that long so I suppose I don't know). A cute (and this game does have charming art) and casual puzzle game should not be unplayable because I can't see the images. It might be easy to make a game that's no problem for you to see, but there are lots of people who would love to play your game but can't because of disabilities. It takes a bit more effort, but making a game accessible to everyone means that so many more people will be able to enjoy it. Please do better, developers. I would be willing to try other games by this team (because this is a cute and clever game), but I cannot recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095668425', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1674206088}
review:
Puzzle game de 5/6 heures, découpé en 4 mondes sur une trentaine de niveaux.
Game play bien étudié, pas de redondance et de durée de via artificiellement rallongée.
Il faut jouer sur les "monstres d'ombre" qui déambulent et se transforment à la lumière (en échelle, trampoline, bombe, ...) pour arriver au bout du niveau.
Plein de petits secrets à dénicher dans chaque niveau pour retrouver toutes les étoiles à collectionner.
Seul petit bémol, la traduction française niveau CP bourrée de fautes d'orthographe, mais on arrive quand même à comprendre.
Donc un bon petit jeu du genre, très agréable à jouer :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960496368', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1673188818}
review:
Got stuck at one of the submarine levels and asked myself, do I really want to deal with this anymore?

The answer was no.
And you can save money by using my answer if you so wish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392470928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1654946184}
review:
[b]Plot[/b]
The game leaves you to search for the meaning of the story yourself. You don’t have to venture through every door but if you do then you’ll know what this game means to the developer. It’s a really beautiful little story that you don’t have to delve into but will encounter a much more meaningful experience if you do.

[b]Character[/b]
There’s not much to the boy we control beyond how he obviously is perceiving the world around him. Given we control him he appears to be without fear, easily dodging the shadow creatures without a care but at the same time we know these games are figments of his imagination and that he really is a scared little boy living through a confusing experience.

[b]Environment, Art & Design[/b]
The music is surprisingly beautiful for such a short game, it’s got a Fez-like, retro feel to it’s sound with synthesizers and jump noises. The pixel based backgrounds are simple yet make you want to just stop and look at them, especially the sun and moon levels.

[b]Mechanics[/b]
Very simple stuff for the boy which was enjoyable, lending itself to focusing on the logic puzzle rather than your abilities. The range of shadow creatures was good too and mixing their abilities throughout the levels felt natural and challenging.

[b]Tidbits[/b]
I was mildly enjoying the game before I started looking at how to enter the blocked off rooms and it was then that I really came to appreciate it. The puzzles on their own were good, the meaning and story added so much more to the experience. It became the sort of game that you want to thank the developer for sharing.

[b]Negatives (cause I’m picky)[/b]
The game had a few bugs towards the end. I think I got hardlocked in one level and couldn’t progress so ended up dragging boxes in piles across the platform to reach my goal XD The penultimate level too I’m positive I cheated but I also couldn’t find a working solution. It didn’t deter my enjoyment and to some extent excited some unexpected problem solving but it didn’t quite reach a perfect finished product.
Also, a bug with boxes and light source interaction where the box would clip through the floor when it entered a light source (particularly in the gravity levels) and then would destroy itself as a fix. The destruction was quite helpful to reset it but it would be better if it didn’t happen at all.

[b]Conclusion[/b]
A lovely, fairly short game with thought provoking mechanics and a sentiment that will stick with me. It's not perfect but I'm glad to have played it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247040340', 'num_games_owned': 943, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1651623529}
review:
What an underrated puzzle platformer! I enjoyed a lot my time with it and hoped it would last just a little longer. The puzzles where very good, loved the mechanics and the secret rooms telling the story behind the game even better. While some people say it is similar to "FEZ" (and i do see some likeness) for me it was much more similar to "Full Bore". 
To anyone that loved "Full Bore" I highly recomend to play "In the Shadows". It's a piece of art!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035100973', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 766, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1626269660}
review:
Solid art and concept.

But the mechanics and level design are a bit tedious at times, even if the solution is fairly obvious, it takes a bit too long to actually execute.

The movement is also a bit clunky and multiple times I experienced weird physics, mostly with moving light sources and boxes around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019895634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1625705164}
review:
In The Shadows is a game that deserves much more attention. The beautifully crafted voxel 2D world compliments the lighting and colours, to create various tones to deliver each chapter of the game. 

With each chapter a new mechanic is introduced to the player. First by offering a simple puzzle to demonstrate how it works, before being gently lead into more challenging but fair scenarios, which make you think about how to use the world and the mechanics in front of you.

The mechanics, while fairly simple, introduce new ways of solving and thinking about puzzles, all of which reinforce the key themes of the game; light/dark and the passage of time. 

At just over 2 hours long (In my experience) for the core game, it offers a concise but interesting experience. Would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057870177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1621436532}
review:
The developer of this game has clearly poured a lot of passion into this game, from the emotional, yet entirely unobtrusive, narrative and themes to the charming design of each new area. A puzzle platformer which puts you into levels containing shadow monsters, and various lights which scare the monsters so that they morph into useful objects which help you navigate the room and collect the stars. 

There are some interesting mechanics as the smooth difficulty curve escalates throughout the game, however its unfortunate that some of its best ideas are short lived and don't function as smoothly as you'd like. That being said there's plenty to keep the levels varied and enjoyable throughout. If you're looking for a mind-bendingly difficult puzzler this is certainly not it, however that feels like the game's intention; although there are challenging moments the objective here is more of a sleepy experience for the player. 

While it may not be perfect the atmospheric, steady pace is enough to draw you in and make the 3-5 hour experience (depending how many secrets you wanna look for) well worth the few quid you'll pay for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198823307038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1671215215}

author: {'steamid': '76561198115820587', 'num_games_owned': 3074, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1511634863}
review:
Puzzle/plateforme 2D. Un gamin contre les ombres.

Je dois avouer que j'ai mis énormément de temps avant de temps avant de rentrer dans le jeu: maniabilité assez lourde, narration quasi absente, progression lente, les premiers niveaux sont beaucoup simples et nécessitent d'attendre, encore et encore, c'est pas agréable. J'ai dû limite me forcer à jouer sur les premières sessions, je faisais 1 niveau puis passait à autre chose sans avoir envie d'y revenir.

Puis cet aprem, j'ai enfin passé le premier monde, après 45mn de jeu environ. Et là, illumination! Dès le début du second monde, les niveaux sont bons, avec quelques phases de plateforme bienvenues. Les énigmes sont originales, pas compliquées mais elles demandent de bien comprendre les mécaniques de jeu et sont souvent renouvelées. L'histoire se dévoile petit à petit, malgré une narration toujours timide. Ça se laisse suivre, sans être bouleversant.

Pas d'attaque ici, pas de gameover, si on se fait toucher on recommence quelques pas plus tôt. Les énigmes consistent à observer différentes ombres bouger dans les tableaux, et de les éclairer afin de leur faire subir une transformation qui permet de progresser. Il faudra évidemment combiner ses transformations pour avancer dans le jeu, et parfois bien se casser la tête afin de récupérer toutes les étoiles des niveaux, sortes de bonus.

Du coup j'ai joué (presque) tout l'aprem, j'ai retourné le jeu à 100%, j'ai bien aimé malgré une trop faible durée de vie (4h30).

Un bon petit jeu pas très ambitieux donc, avec un début qui peine à se lancer, mais qui sait se renouveler et avec des énigmes très bien trouvées.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970800104', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1615081693}
review: Adorably inventive 2D puzzle platformer - in the same vein as Braid and Fez - where you use light sources to transform monsters into props to your advantage. The voxel artwork is beautiful - especially the use of light and shadows - the puzzles are well thought out and the audio makes things feel very relaxing. It’s a little buggy - nothing that can’t be fixed with a room reset - but this game has a lot of heart The small story segments were very thoughful and, obviously, very personal to the developer. Lovely stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058815587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1614078634}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993669981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1609865686}
review: I saw this game at a student developer showing at a college in Montreal some time ago and was very impressed so when I saw it on Steam I had to try it out. The game is very good, the story, design and game play are very well thought out. I am a big fan of unique puzzle games, kind of tired of the same stuff so I look for more original designs and this one fits the bill with a nice light and shadow based game play that adds new concepts as you go through the levels to keep it interesting, even to the point where I would have liked to see even more levels with certain mechanics (like the movement of the sun or the shadow mirroring levels). Given this it must also be noted that there are some issues which I am sure could have been polished with more time. The controls are less responsive than ideal (mainly the jumping), there were some glitches where I had to restart the level as my shadow no longer jumped, the respawn points were often off leaving you in an area that forced a level restart plus a few other minor bugs. None of these really were much of an issue though, so I still really recommend trying it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138829235', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1607732501}

author: {'steamid': '76561198165650900', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1601424375}
review:
빛과 그림자괴물을 이용해 별들을 모아 탈출하는 퍼즐게임으로 나오는 요소들은 한정적이지만 짜임새있게 잘 만들어졌습니다. 이따금 문제가 있다면 한번씩 빛이 없음에도 원래대로 돌아오지 않는 그림자 괴물과(버그인듯).. 돌이킬수없는 실수를 했을때 그것을 바로 알아차릴만한 요소가 없어 계속 한자리에서 삽질하게되는 경우가 있다는 것 그외에는 다 좋았습니다

[spoiler]개발자 자신의 친형제를 추모하며 만든 [/spoiler] 게임인걸 알고서 플레이하는게 더 게임의 장면이나 상황 이해에 더 도움이 될거라고 생각하지만 혹시 몰라 가림막처리해두었습니다

퍼즐이 불친절한 부분이 있지만 그래픽도 아름답고 꽤 괜찮은 게임인데 그다지 조명받지못한듯하여 아쉽네요

author: {'steamid': '76561198006575550', 'num_games_owned': 1631, 'num_reviews': 625, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1513446745}
review:
Beautiful looking game with interesting puzzles. You turn the enemies into what you need to get through a level! A slower paced game which will be relaxing for some. You have to wait for enemies to get into position before you can use light to convert them. Which might be a little too slow for some.

Overall, the shadows are well designed and each level is beautiful.

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/26701155-The-Pepp-Selection] Click to see my curator for more reviews! [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198781750764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1579656847}
review: This game is super relaxing from the artwork to the music.  You could go from beginning to end in this game fairly quickly but if you are looking to 100% the story of the game along with all of the achievements, it can be quite challenging.  Some of the star collectibles can be a real brain twister to collect and there are a few hidden rooms that can be pretty tough to find.  Overall, it was a relaxing and fun experience with a touching story tucked into it as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059526840', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1530985504}
review:
This game is soooo close to being a game that is ready for the market, but there is are a few things that keep me from recommending this game: primarily, bugs. During my playthrough of this game, I encountered the same glitches over and over again. Sometimes it would be bad behavior of the NPCs, who started floating and then would completely freeze, forcing me to restart the level from the beginning. Sometimes I would just fall through the floor, forcing me to restart the level from the beginning. I must have encountered at least a dozen different instances where I could reliably say "that shouldn't be happening", and that's in a complete, start-to-finish, 4 hour playthrough. That's too many bugs, most of which were game breaking or forced me out of the atmosphere, or both.

Next is the general lack of polish on some game mechanics. Now, this is a puzzle game, so the game is supposed to be somewhat difficult of course, but sometimes the mechanics would screw you over, pushing boxes where they weren't supposed to go, forcing you to backtrack several minutes to get to where you wanted to be again. Sometimes it was behaving frustratingly where sometimes shadows would activate at a shorter distance than they deactivate, and other inconveniences that were either part of poor level design or poor game design.

There also seemed to be a story somewhere in the game, but it was impossible to figure out and overall distracted from the game than it added to the game. This could use a lot of fleshing out; I might even be able to forgive bugs and poorly implemented mechanics if the story was enjoyable.

The atmosphere and soundtrack were incredible, and the visuals tied it all together beautifully. The game is a great proof of concept; and there's a good game within the mechanics, but the level design and glitches make it more frustrating than it is a good game. On top of that, this game sports a $16 price tag; for that price, you could get games that are more polished and more fun with a better story. This game is not worth $16; it only has 4-5 hours worth of content, maybe up to 8 if you want to 100% it. If you can get it on sale for $10 or less, and you're really a fan of atmospheric puzzle games and can withstand ample bugs, by all means try it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977846406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1609962670}
review:
In the Shadows is a little gem of an indie game!

I really enjoyed the pixel art and animation in this puzzle game.
Clearly a lot of time and effort was put into the visual aesthetic and soundtrack and it makes for a very atmospheric experience.

Most puzzles are a joy to figure out, but I did run into 2 or 3 that required too specific a timing and execution to complete for my taste.
Overall however the levels never outstay their welcome, on top of that all of them are nicely varied and beautifully detailed.

I like how it leaves you the option as a player to play it just as a puzzle-platformer or dig a little deeper to see what secrets you may find.
For me personally the story really struck a note.

It surprises me that this game didn't get more attention than it did: glad that I picked this one up!

Recommended if you like puzzle-platformers, interactive storyteling, pixel art and good soundtracks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019708471', 'num_games_owned': 1520, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1525938041}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023466339', 'num_games_owned': 1344, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1514392880}
review: Quite easy game to relax. Great work mixing pixel art with voxels but in high frame rates like with my monitor at 144hz some artifacts can be seen, maybe is just me but even with that no a huge thing. The game is sort that is the only really bad thing about it but enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023925975', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1497222131}
review: Great little game with pleasingly challenging puzzles and a lovely art style. Worth a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056028931', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1514139393}
review:
The platforming and puzzles are super fun, and some very challenging.  Very unique approaches used throughout the game to figure out puzzle solutions.
The pixel art and attention to detail is stunning.
Music and SFX are really great.
The best part though is the incredibe, touching storyline.  You can really FEEL the emotions of the characters.  You're invested from the start and just want to keep progressing to dive deeper into the story to see where it takes you.
Stay for the ending, you'll be blown away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034702772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1518913214}
review: I've been following the devlopement of this game on Reddit for almost a year now, and I'm really happy with how the final product turned out. There is a lot of charm in this game that comes from its simplicity and style. I think everyone should give it a shot even if they have the slightest of interests in it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050967938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1512081011}
review:
Recensione positiva ma con riserva.

Il gioco è splendido graficamente, davvero tra le migliori pixel art grazie ai bellissimi giochi di luce. Anche i controlli funzionano molto bene. 

Il suo problema è la mancanza di un qualcosa che riesca a tenere alta l'attenzione oltre ai puzzle. L'obiettivo è sempre di raccogliere le stelle in varie schermate. I puzzle richiedono alcuni passaggi logici e sono ben strutturati, ma non ho sentito lo stimolo a proseguire nel gioco.

Probabilmente ottimo per gli amanti dei puzzle platform più cervellotici e ne riconosco meriti oggettivi anche se dubito che lo continuerò.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160086954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1511623983}
review:
Unglaublich. Man kann einfach nicht aufhören alles Rätsel der Sterne zu lösen. Ein super originelles Puzzle-Spiel. 
Der Indie-Titel des Jahres 2017

author: {'steamid': '76561198042023224', 'num_games_owned': 1596, 'num_reviews': 1033, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1510401326}
review:
별 헤이는 밤, 추억을 회상하는 그리움.

알짱거리는 그림자 몬스터들은 빛을 비추면 스프링이나 사다리, 문, 열쇠 등의 사물로 변한다. 이 특성을 활용해 각 스테이지마다 숨겨져 있는 별들을 획득하고 출구에 도달해야 한다. 그림자를 사물로 활용하는 메커니즘이 꽤 기발하고, 각 스테이지의 레벨 디자인 역시 정교하고 기지가 넘친다. 그 밖에 숨겨진 구역이나 이스터 에그들도 갖출 만큼은 갖춘 모습. 다만 때때로 터지는 렉과 버그가 조금 아쉽다. 어느 한 스테이지에서는 그림자에 부딪혀 리젠이 됐을 때 아예 스테이지의 외부에서 리젠이 될 때가 있었다. 순간 슈퍼마리오인줄.

아마도 괜찮을 듯 하니 한 가지 스포를 하자면, 이 게임은 개발자 자신의 형을 추모하기 위해 만들어진 게임인 듯 하다. (게임의 엔딩과 스텝롤을 보면 짐작할 수 있다.) 게임의 줄거리는 조금 뜬금없이 과거와 현재를 왕래하여, 전반적으로 모호하게 흘러가는 감이 있어 갈피를 잡기 어려운데, 하늘로 떠난 형에 대한 추모를 암시하는 메세지를 게임 상에 보다 직접적으로 넣었더라면 좀 더 좋았을 것 같다. 어차피 게임 자체가 그림자와 별을 테마로 한 서정적이고 감성적인 게임이니 말이다.

픽셀 그래픽과 음악도 수준급이고 퍼즐 위주의 게임플레이도 성공적인 재미를 보장한다. 제법 훌륭한 게임인데 게임의 제목처럼 그림자에 가려 빛을 보지 못하고 있는 게 아쉬울 뿐.

※현재 한글 패치를 적용하면 아케이드 게임을 플레이할 수 없는 버그가 있다. 주의할 것.

http://blog.naver.com/kitpage/221150462572

author: {'steamid': '76561198072621642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1509726299}
review: In The Shadows is a beautiful Indie puzzle platformer. In the game, you repel various shadow monsters using sources of light at your disposal. The objective is to solve each puzzles and find the exit. The monsters you scare away transform into various objects which allows you to progress further (ladders, trampolines, etc). For more challenge, you can also try to collect all the Stars within the levels. This will allow you to play secret levels. The peaceful music gives a lot of atmosphere to the gameplay and the visual artwork is gorgeous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251049912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1524058131}
review: Unique feel and look with great puzzles and experience. Another indy that doesn't disappoints!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988485471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1509229591}
review:
This is a pixel art puzzle platformer that's similar to FEZ and also has some similar aspects to Braid. Any casual or experienced gamer should be able to get the hang of this game and find it enjoyable. The controls are relatively simple and the environment is beautiful to navigate through. The use of 3D lighting within what seems like a regular 2D sidescroller really brings something fresh and eye catching to the genre. The music also does a great job to immerse you and tie everything together. The worlds were interesting with neat places to explore, and secret rooms to find! The story was captivating and brought the game to a close with a very emotional ending. The puzzles were fun and were definitely challenging in places. However, there aren’t any rage quitting or ridiculous puzzles here. Each of the monster’s mechanics were great to play around with.

There’s not much bad to say about this game. There were a couple issues of the character clipping through the background or spawning in an odd place. The screen resolution seemed to reset every time I started the game. To be picky, I’d say the somewhat stereotypical pixel art game sound effects were a little hard to get used to and didn’t seem to fit in well with the environment at first.

Personally, I really enjoyed this game, even though it is a bit short. Within 6.6 hours I completed all the achievements in the game, and I wasn’t going very fast doing it. I still feel like I got my money’s worth out of it. I’d recommend this game to anyone that’s remotely interested in games like this. I also do recommend you solve all the puzzles to get to all the parts of the story!

To the Dev: I’ve been following this game for a couple years now, back when I was very interested in video game development and wanted to make something of my own. I’m so happy to see this game progress, release, and become what it is today. The ending really hit me hard. You should be very proud of what you created here!

author: {'steamid': '76561198110855190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1535391981}
review:
Inside, Limbo와 비슷한 느낌은 준 게임.

여러분들이 Inside와 Limbo에서 재미와 여운을 느끼셨다면 추천합니다.


이 게임은 튜토리얼(처음 나오는 스테이지)조차 난이도가 상당히 높습니다.

물론 제 게임실력이 출중하지 못하다는 점을 감안하더라도 난해함을 느꼈습니다.

소개를 위해 상점페이지에서 제공하는 영상과 사진은 정말 적절합니다.

게임의 특징을 정말 자세하게 보여주고 있습니다.

그래도 장점과 단점을 나누자면.

장점
1. 충분히 고민할만한 퍼즐 난이도.

2. 하나 하나에 의미가 담기고 보기 좋은 픽셀그래픽.
(퍼즐 말고도 액자에 걸린 그림이라든가, 주변 조형물들을 한번 확인해보세요.)


단점
1. 단조로운 배경음악.(거의 한가지만 나온거 같습니다.)

2. 고비가 너무 일찍 찾아옵니다.(초반부터 너무 어려워서 포기할뻔했습니다... 크으...) 


상점페이지의 영상과 사진으로도 충분히 게임에 대한 설명이 가득하지만, 영상링크를 남겨두겠습니다.

https://youtu.be/OljACkRWUdc

author: {'steamid': '76561197991540588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1511496090}
review:
In the Shadows is a game with a soul. Behind the beautiful looks and ambience is a good puzzler with a story to tell.
Some of the puzzles are still giving me a hard time, this is a good sign :). Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018686466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1512360420}
review: So far this is a great puzzle game with amazing artwork. The game has a similar flow to games like Super Meat Boy and Escape Goat in that there's a handful of stages with each being divided into short levels that require overcoming a puzzle. The puzzles are much slower paced than the preceding games mentioned, and involve manipulating light sources to transform shadow creatures into various objects to help collect stars. Definitely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150456587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1508554610}
review:
Beautiful and immersive puzzle platformer

The atmosphere, artwork and aesthetic of this game are fantastic. I don't normally play many platform games but I was immediately taken with In the Shadows. The use of light as an effect and as a mechanic is perfectly crafted, as is the soundtrack which is equally beautiful and eerie. I really recommend buying this right away!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051522841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1509300952}
review:
[i]I supported the game on Kickstarter, because I found the visuals appealing, and the creator seemed to put a lot of thought into the game.[/i]


[h1]In The Shadows is a fun, little and very atmospheric puzzle game.[/h1]

Having played only a few levels, the first game that immediately popped into my mind was Fez. In The Shadows is thick with atmosphere and tells a story, that you unlock by finding more secrets. The puzzles in the game have an appropriate range of difficulty, although some levels are rather short. And at times I wasn't sure if I solved the riddle or just happened to find a workaround. But I suppose that's also part of the charm in puzzle games.
At two points in the game I stumbled upon a bug, but you can always restart the levels, and since the levels are short - the bugs are by no means game breaking.

The game itself took me about 5 hours to complete, having found all the stars in all but one level. That's a bit too short for my taste at the current price, but if you're a fan of puzzle games - it's no excuse to miss out on this experience.

There's a handful of worlds, each stoked up with levels. Each world is well-crafted and offers a unique theme. In general the game was fun to play and I recommend fans of puzzle games to try it out for themselves!


[b]"(3/5) A nice game - you should buy it, only if you're a fan of the genre."[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198273279763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1508629143}
review: Overall, In The Shadows is an enjoyable puzzle game with some platforming parts. Having followed the devlog and after backing ITS on Kickstarter, it was good to finally play it. It took about four hours to complete, plus I spent some extra time on trying to collect all the stars with many rooms yet to be completed. However, there are a few things that could've made it even better. Pros: -Beautiful visuals. My guess is that most people assume that the game uses pixel graphics but actually it's using [spoiler]voxels (i.e. 3d pixels). [/spoiler] That's why casting shadows with lights looks so good. Check out the Cubicle Constructor link in the description. -Puzzles. Having played lots of games over the decades, I still found many of the light/shadow mechanic puzzles interesting. Collect all the stars on every level for extra challenge. -Great soundtrack. Both for the game and also for stand-alone listening. -After completing a level, that level can be easily accessed. So if you've already found all the stars on some levels then you can skip those if you wish to find all the stars on every level. Cons: -Puzzle variety. Having followed the devlog, the developer's signature picture has 11 shadow creatures. I assumed that all of those would be in the game, but ... I think you know where I'm going with this. -Story. There are certain things (memory sequences) that give the game a certain framework, but there are two things that would've been better. 1) The beginning. Having seen/read/heard many stories and being a puzzle fan, I guessed early on what the events were about. That actually didn't bother me much. Rather, it was the beginning where I felt that the intro cutscene could've explained a bit more. Without that, you just have a sence that "something is wrong" and you're going on some kind of journey but not sure why. Adding a few more details regarding what the situation is about would've given more connection to the character and could've helped with motivation. 2) I thought that there would be more to [spoiler]the shadow creatures other than their utility function. Yes, there is a vague "connection" but there could've been more. Perhaps each could've represented something.[/spoiler] -There is one achivement called I remember it all. Perhaps if you collect all the stars and watch the memory scenes, then some of issues mentioned above might be resolved. However, it would've been nice to have a full closure after a normal play through without an NG+ or "achievemnt-wall". -Sound effects. The "pixel game" sounds. I don't mind those for actual pixel games but the visuals of this game are much more detailed and I would prefer the sound effects to be "high resolution". Especially, since the music isn't "pixel style" either. Due to visuals and overall atmosphere, I'll play it again and try to find all the stars or sometimes a nice "mini-vacation". :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042818937', 'num_games_owned': 1061, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1508621828}
review:
I LOVE THIS GAME! I felt like I was playing FEZ again for the first time! 

The developer's use of light and shadows in the game is amazing compared to other pixel-art platformers and is very refreshing!

So far I have played the first 10 levels or so, and I have got to say that the game is very reminiscent of FEZ on how the character's movement is paced. You don't run around like in other platformers e.g. meatboy. It's more of a fast-walking or jogging speed.

That being said the controls are fine and play into the core game really well. The only issue I have is there are a few clipping issues on some of the platforms, but honestly nothing I found to be game breaking or repetetively annoying.

Some segments are more challenging than others early on however you can always skip them and head straight for the door if you're feeling overwhelmed. The caveat to this is in later stages the door becomes harder and harder to reach and more obstacles get in your way. This isn't always the case but for certain stages it is.

Story wise, there isn't necessarily a ton of content there, however, the atmosphere the minor amount of story builds up is perfect for what the game offers. It's not exactly what you would call "Story driven". Like I said, again, it is very atmospheric.

Music isn't half bad either and I didn't find the background music to be repetetive, just fitting for the mood.

The enemies in the game consist of various shadow creatures that turn into utility objects when exposed to light. It's definitely something different, because in some circumstances you will have to avoid touching them but also quickly turn on a light to turn them into a usable object and it can get somewhat tense. The caveat to this is for some reason dying does not reset the level, it just places you on a nearby platform you recently were standing on. It removes some of the threat from the enemies in my opinion.

Overall the game is great, I'd give it a solid 8/10 and would recommend it if you're interested in the platformer genre. It has controller support so there's that as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970680543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1508550400}
review:
This is a great game.  I saw it at PAX East a couple years ago, got in on the kickstarter, and happy to see it's released!  The atmosphere, music, animations, and lighting are really well done, so it feels a lot more immersive than I would have expected for a puzzle game.  Plus it seems like there's a nice curve of new and surprising stuff as you go -- I've only got about an hour on it and it felt like it got even more fun as I progressed.

One small thing though is that despite saving and applying my changes several times, my gamepad control settings just didn't seem to stick at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003511717', 'num_games_owned': 1767, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1508391551}
review:
这游戏其实就是个解谜游戏了 怪物会在固定地点出生 并且会在黑暗区域到处活动 但只要碰到光亮就会变成其他东西帮助你过关（比如第一个区域的蹦床和楼梯 第二个区域的门等等）如果你是用发光的箱子的话 他们会停在光源边界处不敢前进 这时候只要把箱子推向他们就好
除了解谜之外 也不乏一些横版过关的元素 比如第一个区域最后一关有一部分是要你照好时机从一堆阴影怪中间跳跳板过去 最为一个小插曲还是挺不错的
总体来说游戏性挺不错的 不过整体进程显得比较慢 第一个区域一个小时内可以通关 解谜游戏老手可能可以更快 我原本是以为只有这一个区域的 比较尴尬 因为元素不算多 难度也只有最后两关比较有意思 但后来发现第一个区域之后会解锁新世界 从墙上海报来看应该有四个区域 在第二个区域明显出现了不同元素 所以还是值得期待后续发展的
就目前（发售前两天）来看 还有一些细微的BUG 比如爬梯子总会在最高处抖一下 以及第一个区域最后一关有个地方不小心的话会进入死循环 但是作者在email里说一些已发现的BUG都会在发售当天的更新被修复 所以应该是没什么问题的
画面方面感觉是像素游戏里算精致的了 特别是光源阴影的效果 挺棒的 不过第一次打开游戏的话分辨率可能不是最佳设置 会导致字体模糊 比例不对有黑边等问题 可以自行切换一下分辨率（窗口模式的开关也有个BUG 不管你设置的是什么 只要再次改动分辨率就会切回全屏模式 所以你得多切换两次窗口模式 不过都是小问题 也就第一次的时候捣鼓一下就好）
不过话说回来其实我一开始在kickstarter上back的时候并没有仔细看游戏玩法……还以为是通过光线阴影让建筑物显示出明显的分割线给玩家踩 否则就没有碰撞体积呢……想想那种玩法估计也会很有意思呀【x

author: {'steamid': '76561198077157970', 'num_games_owned': 2487, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1508727798}
review:
[h1] In the Shadows - Review[/h1] 

In the Shadows utiliza un concepto tan simple como el miedo a la oscuridad para elaborar situaciones lógicas muy bien definidas. Toda la aventura gira entorno a la idea de atrapar estrellas, y con su iluminación desbloquear el acceso a la siguiente área, eventualmente eso podría resultar en algo redundante. Por suerte, todos y cada uno de sus escenarios introducen nuevos elementos, tales como mecánicas o personajes que irán agregando nuevos comportamientos y variedad. Figuras monstruosas que se ven afectadas por un haz de luz y se convierten en cajas, escaleras, trampolines e incluso llaves para acceder a otros ambientes en un mismo Puzzle. Sin duda, es un detalle genial que ayuda a quitar la sensación de monotonía. 
En lo jugable, In the Shadows toma mucha inspiración de otras emblemáticas obras como Contrast, por su temática o FEZ por la escenografía y progresión. 

En conjunto es un juego excelente, tanto en lo jugable como en lo narrativo. A simple vista, la historia no es uno de sus principales atributos, es más, In the Shadows se presenta como una constante sucesión de Puzzles. Sin embargo, tras esa cortina de razonamiento se esconde una historia cautivadora, de tal modo, que con las palabras justas logra expresar un relato de amor y aceptación. 
Quizás la duración es algo escasa, In the Shadows cuenta con tan solo 4 mundos, y estos se abastecen con alrededor de 8-9 habitaciones. Una cifra algo baja, pero con un contenido admirable y un diseño de Puzzles meticuloso. La única contra son sus Bugs. Al contar con Puzzles milimétricamente calculados salirse de ese patrón puede conllevar a un error o un bloqueo definitivo  que solo se soluciona al reiniciar el capítulo. No es algo que suceda a menudo, pero cuando lo hace es tedioso, cuanto poco. 

En definitiva, In the Shadows es un acertado juego de plataformas y Puzzles con un preciso planteamiento jugable y una gloriosa dirección artística.

[b]Para leer el análisis completo dirigirse al siguiente enlace:[/b]

[url=https://pcindiemrace.com/2017/10/20/in-the-shadows-review/] PC Indie Master Race [/url]
